bugs.title: CVE-2018-14354 mutt: Remote code injection vulnerability to an IMAP mailbox

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14354 mutt: Remote code injection vulnerability to an IMAP mailbox

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in mutt before 1.10.1. When "subscribing" to an IMAP mailbox, either via $imap_check_subscribed, or via the
<subscribe> function in the browser menu, the lack of proper input parsing may lead to remote code injection from a malicous IMAP server.

Upstream patch:

References:

http://www.mutt.org/news.html
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/blob/master/ChangeLog

Created attachment 1459535
upstream patch

Created mutt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1602082]

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/185152818541f5cdc059cbff3f3e8b654fc27c1d
https://github.com/neomutt/neomutt/commit/95e80bf9ff10f68cb6443f760b85df4117cb15eb

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2018:2526 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:2526

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14362 mutt: POP body caching path traversal vulnerability

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14362 mutt: POP body caching path traversal vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in mutt before 1.10.1. There is a path traversal flaw for UID values in POP bcache directory.

References:

http://www.mutt.org/news.html
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/blob/master/ChangeLog

Created attachment 1459536
upstream patch

Created mutt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1602082]

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/6aed28b40a0410ec47d40c8c7296d8d10bae7576

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2018:2526 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:2526

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14355 mutt: IMAP header caching path traversal vulnerability

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14355 mutt: IMAP header caching path traversal vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in mutt before 1.10.1. There is a path traversal flaw in IMAP header caching.

References:

http://www.mutt.org/news.html
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/blob/master/ChangeLog

Created attachment 1459537
upstream patch

Created mutt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1602082]

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/31eef6c766f47df8281942d19f76e35f475c781d
Setting rhel-6 as wontfix and closing tracker. Our policy specifies that we may not fix moderate flaws for rhel-6.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2020:1126 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2020:1126

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-14355

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14357 mutt: Remote Code Execution via backquote characters

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14357 mutt: Remote Code Execution via backquote characters

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. They allow remote IMAP servers to execute arbitrary commands via backquote characters, related to the mailboxes command associated with an automatic subscription.


References:
http://www.mutt.org/news.html

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/185152818541f5cdc059cbff3f3e8b654fc27c1d
https://github.com/neomutt/neomutt/commit/e52393740334443ae0206cab2d7caef381646725

Created mutt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1602916]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2018:2526 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:2526

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14350 mutt: stack-based buffer overflow in imap/message.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14350 mutt: stack-based buffer overflow in imap/message.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. imap/message.c has a stack-based buffer overflow for a FETCH response with a long INTERNALDATE field.


References:
http://www.mutt.org/news.html

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/3287534daa3beac68e2e83ca4b4fe8a3148ff870

Created mutt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1602923]

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14349 mutt: Heap Overflow in imap/command.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14349 mutt: Heap Overflow in imap/command.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. imap/command.c mishandles a NO response without a message.


References:
https://neomutt.org/2018/07/16/release

Upstream Patch:

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14351 mutt: IMAP status mailbox literal mishandled in imap/command.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14351 mutt: IMAP status mailbox literal mishandled in imap/command.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. imap/command.c mishandles a long IMAP status mailbox literal count size.


References:
http://www.mutt.org/news.html

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/e57a8602b45f58edf7b3ffb61bb17525d75dfcb1

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14352 mutt: stack-based buffer overflow in imap/util.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14352 mutt: stack-based buffer overflow in imap/util.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. imap_quote_string in imap/util.c does not leave room for quote characters, leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.


References:
http://www.mutt.org/news.html

Upstream Patch:
https://gitlab.com/muttmua/mutt/commit/e0131852c6059107939893016c8ff56b6e42865d

Created mutt tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14358 mutt: stack-based buffer overflow in imap/message.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14358 mutt: stack-based buffer overflow in imap/message.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. imap/message.c has a stack-based buffer overflow for a FETCH response with a long RFC822.SIZE field.

http://www.mutt.org/news.html
